trans-unit.source: Using offline data in Mobile Services (Xamarin Android) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Using offline data in Mobile Services (Xamarin Android) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to cache and sync offline data in your Xamarin Android application
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to cache and sync offline data in your Xamarin Android application

trans-unit.source: Using offline data sync in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Using offline data sync in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This topic walks through the offline sync capabilities of Azure Mobile Services in the todo list quickstart app.
trans-unit.target: This topic walks through the offline sync capabilities of Azure Mobile Services in the todo list quickstart app.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync allows you to easily create apps that are usable even when the end user has no network access.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync allows you to easily create apps that are usable even when the end user has no network access.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync has several potential uses:
trans-unit.target: Offline sync has several potential uses:

trans-unit.source: Improve app responsiveness by caching server data locally on the device
trans-unit.target: Improve app responsiveness by caching server data locally on the device

trans-unit.source: Make apps resilient against intermittent network connectivity
trans-unit.target: Make apps resilient against intermittent network connectivity

trans-unit.source: Allow end-users to create and modify data even when there is no network access, supporting scenarios with little or no connectivity
trans-unit.target: Allow end-users to create and modify data even when there is no network access, supporting scenarios with little or no connectivity

trans-unit.source: Sync data across multiple devices and detect conflicts when the same record is modified by two devices
trans-unit.target: Sync data across multiple devices and detect conflicts when the same record is modified by two devices

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, you should first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, you should first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:

trans-unit.source: [Review the Mobile Services sync code]
trans-unit.target: [Review the Mobile Services sync code]

trans-unit.source: [Update the sync behavior of the app]
trans-unit.target: [Update the sync behavior of the app]

trans-unit.source: [Update the app to reconnect your mobile service]
trans-unit.target: [Update the app to reconnect your mobile service]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio with the [Xamarin extension] or [Xamarin Studio]
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio with the [Xamarin extension] or [Xamarin Studio]

trans-unit.source: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial
trans-unit.target: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Review the Mobile Services sync code
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Review the Mobile Services sync code

trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Services offline sync allows end users to interact with a local database when the network is not accessible.
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Services offline sync allows end users to interact with a local database when the network is not accessible.

trans-unit.source: To use these features in your app, you initialize MobileServiceClient.SyncContext to a local store.
trans-unit.target: To use these features in your app, you initialize MobileServiceClient.SyncContext to a local store.

trans-unit.source: Then reference your table through the IMobileServiceSyncTable interface.
trans-unit.target: Then reference your table through the IMobileServiceSyncTable interface.

trans-unit.source: This section walks through the offline sync related code in ToDoActivity.cs.
trans-unit.target: This section walks through the offline sync related code in ToDoActivity.cs.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, open the project that you completed in the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, open the project that you completed in the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Open the file ToDoActivity.cs.
trans-unit.target: Open the file ToDoActivity.cs.

trans-unit.source: Notice the type of the member toDoTable is IMobileServiceSyncTable.
trans-unit.target: Notice the type of the member toDoTable is IMobileServiceSyncTable.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync uses this sync table interface instead of IMobileServiceTable.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync uses this sync table interface instead of IMobileServiceTable.

trans-unit.source: When a sync table is used, all operations go to the local store and are only synchronized with the remote service with explicit push and pull operations.
trans-unit.target: When a sync table is used, all operations go to the local store and are only synchronized with the remote service with explicit push and pull operations.

trans-unit.source: To get a reference to a sync table, the method GetSyncTable() is used.
trans-unit.target: To get a reference to a sync table, the method GetSyncTable() is used.

trans-unit.source: To remove the offline sync functionality, you would instead use GetTable().
trans-unit.target: To remove the offline sync functionality, you would instead use GetTable().

trans-unit.source: Before any table operations can be performed, the local store must be initialized.
trans-unit.target: Before any table operations can be performed, the local store must be initialized.

trans-unit.source: This is done in the InitLocalStoreAsync method:
trans-unit.target: This is done in the InitLocalStoreAsync method:

trans-unit.source: This creates a local store using the class MobileServiceSQLiteStore, which is provided in the Mobile Services SDK.
trans-unit.target: This creates a local store using the class MobileServiceSQLiteStore, which is provided in the Mobile Services SDK.

trans-unit.source: You can also a provide a different local store implementation by implementing IMobileServiceLocalStore.
trans-unit.target: You can also a provide a different local store implementation by implementing IMobileServiceLocalStore.

trans-unit.source: The DefineTable method creates a table in the local store that matches the fields in the provided type, ToDoItem in this case.
trans-unit.target: The DefineTable method creates a table in the local store that matches the fields in the provided type, ToDoItem in this case.

trans-unit.source: The type doesn't have to include all of the columns that are in the remote database--it is possible to store just a subset of columns.
trans-unit.target: The type doesn't have to include all of the columns that are in the remote database--it is possible to store just a subset of columns.

trans-unit.source: This overload of InitializeAsync uses the default conflict handler, which fails whenever there is a conflict.
trans-unit.target: This overload of InitializeAsync uses the default conflict handler, which fails whenever there is a conflict.

trans-unit.source: To provide a custom conflict handler, see the tutorial [Handling conflicts with offline support for Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: To provide a custom conflict handler, see the tutorial [Handling conflicts with offline support for Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: The method SyncAsync triggers the actual sync operation:
trans-unit.target: The method SyncAsync triggers the actual sync operation:

trans-unit.source: First, there is a call to IMobileServiceSyncContext.PushAsync().
trans-unit.target: First, there is a call to IMobileServiceSyncContext.PushAsync().

trans-unit.source: This method is a member of IMobileServicesSyncContext instead of the sync table because it will push changes across all tables.
trans-unit.target: This method is a member of IMobileServicesSyncContext instead of the sync table because it will push changes across all tables.

trans-unit.source: Only records that have been modified in some way locally (through CUD operations) will be sent to the server.
trans-unit.target: Only records that have been modified in some way locally (through CUD operations) will be sent to the server.

trans-unit.source: Next, the method calls IMobileServiceSyncTable.PullAsync() to pull data from a table on the server to the app.
trans-unit.target: Next, the method calls IMobileServiceSyncTable.PullAsync() to pull data from a table on the server to the app.

trans-unit.source: Note that if there are any changes pending in the sync context, a pull always issues a push first.
trans-unit.target: Note that if there are any changes pending in the sync context, a pull always issues a push first.

trans-unit.source: This is to ensure all tables in the local store along with relationships are consistent.
trans-unit.target: This is to ensure all tables in the local store along with relationships are consistent.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we have called push explicitly.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we have called push explicitly.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we retrieve all records in the remote TodoItem table, but it is also possible to filter records by passing a query.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we retrieve all records in the remote TodoItem table, but it is also possible to filter records by passing a query.

trans-unit.source: The first parameter to PullAsync() is a query ID that is used for incremental sync, which uses the UpdatedAt timestamp to get only those records modified since the last sync.
trans-unit.target: The first parameter to PullAsync() is a query ID that is used for incremental sync, which uses the UpdatedAt timestamp to get only those records modified since the last sync.

trans-unit.source: The query ID should be a descriptive string that is unique for each logical query in your app.
trans-unit.target: The query ID should be a descriptive string that is unique for each logical query in your app.

trans-unit.source: To opt-out of incremental sync, pass null as the query ID.
trans-unit.target: To opt-out of incremental sync, pass null as the query ID.

trans-unit.source: This will retrieve all records on each pull operation, which is potentially inefficient.
trans-unit.target: This will retrieve all records on each pull operation, which is potentially inefficient.

trans-unit.source: To remove records from the device local store when they have been deleted in your mobile service database, you should enable [Soft Delete].
trans-unit.target: To remove records from the device local store when they have been deleted in your mobile service database, you should enable [Soft Delete].

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, your app should periodically call IMobileServiceSyncTable.PurgeAsync() to purge the local store.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, your app should periodically call IMobileServiceSyncTable.PurgeAsync() to purge the local store.

trans-unit.source: Note that the MobileServicePushFailedException can occur for both a push and a pull operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that the MobileServicePushFailedException can occur for both a push and a pull operation.

trans-unit.source: The next tutorial, [Handling conflicts with offline support for Mobile Services], shows how to handle these sync related exceptions.
trans-unit.target: The next tutorial, [Handling conflicts with offline support for Mobile Services], shows how to handle these sync related exceptions.

trans-unit.source: In the class ToDoActivity, the method SyncAsync() is called after the operations that modify data, AddItem() and CheckItem().
trans-unit.target: In the class ToDoActivity, the method SyncAsync() is called after the operations that modify data, AddItem() and CheckItem().

trans-unit.source: It is also called from OnRefreshItemsSelected(), so that users get the latest data whenever they push the Refresh button.
trans-unit.target: It is also called from OnRefreshItemsSelected(), so that users get the latest data whenever they push the Refresh button.

trans-unit.source: The app also performs a sync on launch, since ToDoActivity.OnCreate() calls OnRefreshItemsSelected().
trans-unit.target: The app also performs a sync on launch, since ToDoActivity.OnCreate() calls OnRefreshItemsSelected().

trans-unit.source: Because SyncAsync() is called whenever data is modified, this app assumes that the user is online whenever they are editing data.
trans-unit.target: Because SyncAsync() is called whenever data is modified, this app assumes that the user is online whenever they are editing data.

trans-unit.source: In the next section, we will update the app so that users can edit even when they are offline.
trans-unit.target: In the next section, we will update the app so that users can edit even when they are offline.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the sync behavior of the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the sync behavior of the app

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will modify the app so that it does not sync on app launch or on the insert and update operations, but only when the refresh button is pushed.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will modify the app so that it does not sync on app launch or on the insert and update operations, but only when the refresh button is pushed.

trans-unit.source: Then, you will break the app connection with the mobile service to simulate an offline scenario.
trans-unit.target: Then, you will break the app connection with the mobile service to simulate an offline scenario.

trans-unit.source: When you add data items, they will be held in the local store, but not immediately synced to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: When you add data items, they will be held in the local store, but not immediately synced to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the class ToDoActivity, edit the methods AddItem() and CheckItem() to comment out the calls to SyncAsync().
trans-unit.target: In the class ToDoActivity, edit the methods AddItem() and CheckItem() to comment out the calls to SyncAsync().

trans-unit.source: In ToDoActivity, comment out the definitions of the members applicationURL and applicationKey.
trans-unit.target: In ToDoActivity, comment out the definitions of the members applicationURL and applicationKey.

trans-unit.source: Add the following lines, which reference an invalid mobile service URL:
trans-unit.target: Add the following lines, which reference an invalid mobile service URL:

trans-unit.source: In ToDoActivity.OnCreate(), remove the call to OnRefreshItemsSelected() and replace with:
trans-unit.target: In ToDoActivity.OnCreate(), remove the call to OnRefreshItemsSelected() and replace with:

trans-unit.source: Build and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the app.

trans-unit.source: Add some new todo items.
trans-unit.target: Add some new todo items.

trans-unit.source: These new items exist only in the local store until they can be pushed to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: These new items exist only in the local store until they can be pushed to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The client app behaves as if is connected to the mobile service supporting all create, read, update, delete (CRUD) operations.
trans-unit.target: The client app behaves as if is connected to the mobile service supporting all create, read, update, delete (CRUD) operations.

trans-unit.source: Close the app and restart it to verify that the new items you created are persisted to the local store.
trans-unit.target: Close the app and restart it to verify that the new items you created are persisted to the local store.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to reconnect your mobile service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to reconnect your mobile service

trans-unit.source: In this section you will reconnect the app to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will reconnect the app to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This simulates the app moving from an offline state to an online state with the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This simulates the app moving from an offline state to an online state with the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When you push the Refresh button, data will be synced to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: When you push the Refresh button, data will be synced to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Open ToDoActivity.cs.
trans-unit.target: Open ToDoActivity.cs.

trans-unit.source: Remove the invalid mobile service URL and add back the correct URL and app key.
trans-unit.target: Remove the invalid mobile service URL and add back the correct URL and app key.

trans-unit.source: Rebuild and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild and run the app.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the data looks the same as the offline scenario even though the app is now connected to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the data looks the same as the offline scenario even though the app is now connected to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is because this app always uses the IMobileServiceSyncTable that is pointed to the local store.
trans-unit.target: This is because this app always uses the IMobileServiceSyncTable that is pointed to the local store.

trans-unit.source: Log into the Microsoft Azure Management portal and look at the database for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Log into the Microsoft Azure Management portal and look at the database for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If your service uses the JavaScript backend, you can browse the data from the Data tab of the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: If your service uses the JavaScript backend, you can browse the data from the Data tab of the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the .NET backend for your mobile service, in Visual Studio go to Server Explorer -> Azure -> SQL Databases.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the .NET backend for your mobile service, in Visual Studio go to Server Explorer -> Azure -> SQL Databases.

trans-unit.source: Right click your database and select Open in SQL Server Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Right click your database and select Open in SQL Server Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Notice the data has not been synchronized between the database and the local store.
trans-unit.target: Notice the data has not been synchronized between the database and the local store.

trans-unit.source: In the app, push the refresh button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, push the refresh button.

trans-unit.source: This calls OnRefreshItemsSelected(), which in turn calls SyncAsync().
trans-unit.target: This calls OnRefreshItemsSelected(), which in turn calls SyncAsync().

trans-unit.source: This will perform the push and pull operations, first sending the local store items to the mobile service, then retrieving new data from the service.
trans-unit.target: This will perform the push and pull operations, first sending the local store items to the mobile service, then retrieving new data from the service.

trans-unit.source: Check the database for your mobile service to confirm that changes have been synchronized.
trans-unit.target: Check the database for your mobile service to confirm that changes have been synchronized.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary
